üí¨ Canciller Sergu√©i Lavrov: La diplomacia es una habilidad de escuchar, o√≠r y convencer.

El deseo de declarar la victoria en la Guerra Fr√≠a y establecer el dominio no tiene nada que ver con la diplomacia. Es un puro dictado, sobre todo si tenemos en cuenta los m√©todos que utiliza Occidente. Amenazas, chantaje, sanciones ileg√≠timas, intervenci√≥n por la fuerza bruta en los asuntos internos de otras naciones, como ocurri√≥ en Yugoslavia en 1999, en Irak en 2003 y en Libia en 2011, o "revoluciones de colores", incluso en el espacio postsovi√©tico.

‚ùóÔ∏è Rusia no est√° de acuerdo con esta l√≥gica.

Lo que estamos viviendo no tiene nada que ver con Ucrania, si tenemos en cuenta los intereses del pueblo ucraniano. Se trata del uso descarado de esta naci√≥n por parte de Estados Unidos y sus sat√©lites como herramienta para debilitar a nuestro pa√≠s.

üí¨ Canciller Sergu√©i Lavrov: La globalizaci√≥n, que ha sido promocionada durante las √∫ltimas d√©cadas y sobre la que se ha construido el sistema monetario, financiero y econ√≥mico internacional, ha tenido el √∫nico prop√≥sito de asegurar los intereses de EEUU y sus sat√©lites.

La falta de fiabilidad de este sistema se ha demostrado muchas veces: el abuso del estatus del d√≥lar, as√≠ como la manipulaci√≥n de los procedimientos de la Organizaci√≥n Mundial del Comercio.

Todos los pa√≠ses que piensen en su futuro no deben limitarse a sacar conclusiones, sino adoptar medidas pr√°cticas para construir relaciones econ√≥micas independientes del dictado estadounidense.

‚ùóÔ∏è Dejar de depender de Occidente en √°reas clave para los intereses nacionales es la tarea n√∫mero uno para todo Estado que se respeta a s√≠ mismo.

El Embajador ruso ante la ONU, Vasili Nebenzia, hizo varias declaraciones durante una reuni√≥n del Consejo de Seguridad de dicada a la situaci√≥n en torno a la central nuclear de Zaporiyia.

 Las Fuerzas Armadas ucranianas siguen atacando el territorio de la central casi diariamente, creando un verdadero riesgo de que se produzca un accidente nuclear con consecuencias catastr√≥ficas para todo el continente europeo.

 Los continuos ataques a la planta por parte de Kiev son una consecuencia directa de la aceptaci√≥n criminal de parte de sus testaferros de Occidente. En la √∫ltima reuni√≥n [del Consejo de Seguridad] ni una sola delegaci√≥n de Occidente tuvo el valor de condenar los ataques de las FF.AA. ucranianas y tampoco les pidieron que pararan.

 Parece que nuestros colegas occidentales viven en una realidad paralela, en donde los militares rusos est√°n atacando la central que ellos protegen y utilizan sistemas estadounidenses para ello.

 Rusia NO utiliza la planta con fines militares.

‚ùóEmbassy comment on another anti-Russian statement by the Foreign, Commonwealth and Development Office 

‚ñ™Ô∏è The Embassy has taken note of yet another anti-Russian statement by the Foreign, Commonwealth and Development Office, this time questioning Russia‚Äôs ‚Äúmoral right‚Äù to sit at the G20. We consider this a sign of London‚Äôs apparent despair amid the deadlocked efforts of British foreign policy to impose a perception of our country being internationally isolated on the global community. 

‚ñ™Ô∏è We are puzzled to hear teachings about ‚Äúmoral rights‚Äù from a country, whose colonial crimes, committed almost in all corners of the former ‚Äúempire on which the sun never set‚Äù, are still the subject of extensive studies and discussion around the world. If we start talking about morality, a legitimate question arises ‚Äì by what right does the UK sit at the G20 alongside some countries which had in the past suffered themselves from the predatory, aggressive and bloody wars unleashed by London, the deception and looting of their people, as well as the massive removal of their national assets and cultural attractions. 

‚ñ™Ô∏è We consider such statements especially hypocritical after the UK, together with NATO allies discredited itself by actively participating in illegal and aggressive military campaigns in Yugoslavia, Iraq, Libya and Syria, as well as in other countries of the Middle East and Africa. We would also like to recall the recent BBC investigations of war crimes committed by British soldiers in Afghanistan. 

‚ñ™Ô∏èWe are well aware of the motives pushing the so-called ‚Äúcollective West‚Äù, including the UK, to persist with futile attempts to restore the former comfortable monopoly in international affairs and, for this purpose, to settle scores with independent states that conduct a sovereign policy based on national interests. In this regard we have to remind the FCDO that Western countries today account for only about 12¬†% of the world's population. 

‚ñ™Ô∏èWe call on London to stop undermining the foundations of a successfully established and strengthening polycentric world order, with the G20 being one of its constituent parts, and to demonstrate a responsible and respectful approach to other countries and nations.

Russian Foreign Ministry statement on US House of Representatives Speaker Nancy Pelosi‚Äôs visit to Taiwan

Speaker of the US House of Representatives, Nancy Pelosi, arrived in Taiwan on August 2. 

 We consider her visit a clear provocation in keeping with the US‚Äôs aggressive policy of comprehensive containment of the PRC.

We believe relations between both sides of the Taiwan Strait are exclusively China‚Äôs domestic affair. The Chinese side is entitled to take any measures necessary to protect its sovereignty and territorial integrity in terms of the Taiwan issue.

 Russia's principled position remains unchanged: we operate on the premise that there is only one China, and the PRC government is the only legitimate government representing all of China, and that Taiwan is an inalienable part of China.

In the Joint Statement of the Russian Federation and the People's Republic of China on international relations entering a new era and on sustainable global development, which was adopted after the talks between the leaders of our countries on February 4, the Russian side reaffirmed its adherence to the ‚Äúone China‚Äù principle and opposed the independence of the island in any form.

We call on Washington to refrain from actions, that undermine regional stability and international security, and to recognise the new geopolitical reality, which has no place for US hegemony.

#WeStandWithChina
#ThereIsOnlyOneChina

Yunier Javier Sifonte D√≠az

texts.text: La selecci√≥n masculina cubana de voleibol venci√≥ a Turqu√≠a en la final de la Copa Challenger y

text.text: por primera vez en su historia clasific√≥ a la Liga de Naciones, el torneo √©lite de este deporte a nivel mundial.

texts.text: En el evento efectuado en Sudcorea los caribe√±os

text.text: solo cedieron un set en sus tres partidos

texts.text: y confirmaron los progresos de un deporte que recupera el terreno perdido.

En el duelo que defin√≠a el boleto Cuba abri√≥ con su cuadro titular, compuesto por el pasador Adri√°n Goide, los auxiliares Miguel √Ångel L√≥pez y Osniel Mergarejo, el opuesto Jes√∫s Herrera, los centrales Roamy Alonso y Javier Concepci√≥n y Yonder Garc√≠a como l√≠bero. Sin embargo,

text.text: tras el f√°cil dominio de 25-17 durante del primer set,

texts.text: en el segundo la distribuci√≥n del ataque no funcion√≥ igual y Liv√°n Taboada asumi√≥ el pase.
Aun as√≠, en definitiva

text.text: los antillanos no lograron descontar lo suficiente y ese parcial cerr√≥ 23-25 en su contra.

texts.text: Un menor trabajo en la net y una inestabilidad en el servicio tambi√©n confluyeron para igualar el duelo a un set para cada conjunto.
Durante la tercera manga el conjunto antillano mostr√≥ otra vez la fuerza de la apertura y sali√≥ airoso con pizarra de 25-20. Los

text.text: seis puntos del capit√°n Miguel √Ångel L√≥pez y los cuatro per c√°pita para Javier Concepci√≥n y Jes√∫s Herrera

texts.text: apuntalaron una mejor recepci√≥n y una aceptable defensa de campo.
De esta forma todo qued√≥ listo para el cuarto set,

text.text: finalmente decisivo para los cubanos tras su victoria con id√©ntico marcador de 25-20.

texts.text: Alli apenas dieron oportunidades a sus rivales y tomaron ventaja desde los primeros compases, otra vez

text.text: aupados por los seis tantos de Miguel √Ångel, la solidez de Herrera y los aportes ofensivos de un Osniel Mergarejo que con su servicio desestabiliz√≥ mucho a la defensa rival.
El bloqueo fue otra arma cubana. Foto: Volleyball World.

texts.text: De acuerdo a las estad√≠sticas del partido

text.text: el equipo caribe√±o fue mejor en todos los aspectos de juego salvo en la recepci√≥n

texts.text: , el tradicional punto d√©bil de las escuadras nacionales pero que durante todo el torneo, incluyendo el juego final, tambi√©n mostr√≥ sus progresos.
En el orden individual,

text.text: Miguel √Ångel L√≥pez y el opuesto Jes√∫s Herrera asumieron el peso ofensivo con 20 y 19 puntos, respectivamente.

texts.text: Junto a ellos, los doce tantos del central Roamy Alonso y los once de Mergarejo, incluyendo cuatro

text.text: aces

texts.text: , tambi√©n contribuyeron al √©xito. De igual manera, merece los aplausos

text.text: la excepcional de defensa del l√≠bero Yonder Mart√≠nez, con una efectividad del cien por ciento en este partido.

texts.text: En un torneo donde la Isla solo perdi√≥ un set y derrot√≥ por su orden a Chile y Rep√∫blica Checa para llegar a la final,
Mergarejo y Miguel √Ångel terminaron como l√≠deres en el servicio, con seis

text.text: aces

texts.text: cada uno.
Mientras, el propio Miguel √Ålngel cerr√≥ tercero entre los mejores anotadores (50 puntos) y entre los bloqueadores (7).
Al finalizar el choque el capit√°n cubano dijo

text.text: sentirse feliz por conseguir el cupo ‚Äîantes Cuba termin√≥ cuarta en 2018 y segunda en 2019‚Äî y reconoci√≥ a Turqu√≠a por el partido.

texts.text: ‚ÄúSin embargo, nosotros tambi√©n mantuvimos la concentraci√≥n e hicimos un buen juego. Llegar a la Liga de Naciones significa mucho, porque llev√°bamos varios a√±os sin participar en la √©lite.

text.text: Es un honor y un gran logro representar a Cuba en un torneo como este‚Äù

texts.text: , concluy√≥.
Esta clasificaci√≥n a la Liga de las Naciones de 2023 no solo representar√° el debut de una escuadra cubana en esta competencia, sino que
es ya lo mejor conseguido por la selecci√≥n nacional desde su presencia en los Juegos Ol√≠mpicos de 2016, la Liga Mundial de ese a√±o, m√°s tarde la cita universal de 2018 y el propio torneo

texts.text: Desde entonces,

text.text: el voleibol cubano labr√≥ un camino enfocado en la inserci√≥n de jugadores en diferentes ligas y clubes del planeta

messages.message:
Today Russia celebrates #NavyDay, July 31, by tradition on the last Sunday of this summer month.

For 326 years the Navy safeguarded our nation's interests and borders. It has come a long way ‚Äì from wooden two-masted flat-bottomed boats of Peter the Great‚Äôs era, to formidable nuclear underwater missile cruisers.

The true foundation of the Russian naval traditions was laid on October 30, 1696 when the Boyar Duma, upon the request of Peter the Great, approved his decree on the construction of a navy. 

‚ÄúThe Russian Navy shall set sail.‚Äù

Learn more about the Russian Navy's history, traditions and capabilities.

This year St Petersburg per tradition hosts the Main Naval Parade in honour of the Day. 40+ warships and submarines will take part in it. The pride of our fleet can be seen in the Neva River in the centre of St Petersburg, and at Kronstadt ‚Äì where big surface vessels, which cannot enter the Neva River due to their size, can be viewed. 

#RussianNavy

webpage.title: The lights are going out across Europe
webpage.description: The EU‚Äôs plan for mandatory gas rationing is utterly terrifying.
webpage.author: Fraser Myers

text.text: The lights are going out across Europe
The EU‚Äôs plan for mandatory gas rationing is utterly terrifying.

The EU‚Äôs 27 member states ‚Äì all modern, advanced industrialised economies, some among the richest in the world ‚Äì are about to start rationing their energy supplies. This week, at an extraordinary summit, EU members agreed to a European Commission proposal to slash their gas use by a punishing 15 per cent over the next eight months. From August 2022 to March 2023, the lamps will, quite literally, be going out all over Europe.

texts.text: The immediate spur for this is the prospect of Russia limiting or even cutting off supplies of gas to the EU. According to European Commission president Ursula von der Leyen, even this worst-case, nightmare scenario is ‚Äòlikely‚Äô. European leaders were particularly spooked earlier this month when the Nord Stream 1 gas pipeline, which supplies Russian gas to Germany, had to be shut down for 10 days for repairs. They were afraid it would

text.text: never reopen

texts.text: The EU‚Äôs punishing plan is designed to get Europe through the winter, should the Russians do the unthinkable and turn off the taps completely. If the crisis deepens, voluntary gas cuts could become

text.text: mandatory

texts.text: . The European Commission of unelected technocrats has also explored the use of emergency protocols which could block any country from exercising a veto on mandatory gas cuts and would also prevent the European Parliament from having a say.
As

text.text: Politico
reported

texts.text: in the run-up to this week‚Äôs summit, European governments were ‚Äòbeing asked to sign over their right to energy sovereignty‚Äô, in Brussels‚Äô ‚Äòmost far-reaching power grab‚Äô yet. And with some exemptions ‚Äì for nations not connected to the EU‚Äôs gas and electricity networks ‚Äì this is exactly what has happened. European countries now face crippling energy cuts ‚Äì first self-inflicted, then potentially imposed by Brussels.
Yet in the eyes of the Brussels spin machine, this gas-rationing catastrophe is EU ‚Äòsolidarity‚Äô and ‚Äòunity‚Äô in action. Or even, in the excitable words of European Commission vice-president

text.text: Frans Timmermans

texts.text: , a golden opportunity for Europeans to become ‚Äòmasters of our own energy security this and next winter‚Äô. This is through-the-looking-glass stuff.

text.text: It is hard to overstate the madness of all this. This should not be mistaken for a bold or selfless move to sanction Russia for its horrific invasion of Ukraine. The EU had already agreed to cut Russian gas imports by two-thirds back in March, and to ban 90 per cent of oil imports back in May. No, this plan is about slashing Europe‚Äôs use of gas, wherever it is from. It is about managing Europeans‚Äô ‚Äòdemand‚Äô for energy rather than fixing its supply.

And while all of Europe is dangerously dependent on Russian gas ‚Äì with Russia supplying 40 per cent of imports last year ‚Äì the main concern is Germany. Indeed, it is the world‚Äôs largest importer of natural gas, 55 per cent of which came from Russia last year. It is Germany that this plan really sets out to rescue.

Germany is already having to make drastic cutbacks to energy use. Town councils are dimming or turning off street lights and even traffic lights. Large landlords and housing associations have started turning down the heating on their residents and rationing their hot water. Some local authorities are considering setting up ‚Äòwarm rooms‚Äô for elderly people to gather in the winter.

texts.text: Even Germany‚Äôs much-vaunted industrial sector ‚Äì powered largely by gas ‚Äì is now facing the abyss. Germany now has a trade deficit for the first time in 30 years. Trade-union leaders fear the

text.text: collapse of entire industries

texts.text: . Green Party economy minister Robert Habeck has

text.text: warned

texts.text: of an impending ‚ÄòLehman Brothers-style‚Äô crisis, triggered by gas shortages, that could send shockwaves through the wider economy. And foreign minister Annalena Baerbock even said the government could be ‚Äòbusy‚Äô this winter dealing with ‚Äòpopular uprisings‚Äô (though she has since retracted this).

text.text: So clearly, Germany is in a deep crisis. And via the EU, it is asking (or strong-arming) its European neighbours to share some of the pain.

texts.text: Some fellow member-states were quick to spot the irony in what is effectively an energy bailout of Germany. This is the same Germany that, during the Eurozone debt crisis of the 2010s, insisted that indebted countries had only themselves and their profligacy to blame. Bailouts were offered but strict austerity measures and so-called structural reforms were attached, which laid waste to the southern European economies. The economies of Greece, Italy and Spain have never recovered to their pre-2010 levels. As Spain‚Äôs energy minister put it, when hitting back against the proposals last week: ‚ÄòUnlike other countries [ie, Germany] we have not been living above our energy means.‚Äô Spain was joined by a host of other southern countries in voicing public opposition to the energy-rationing plans. But, as the Spanish energy minister acknowledged, whatever her protestations, the core proposals were really ‚Äòa

text.text: fait accompli

texts.text: ‚Äô. Berlin usually rules in Brussels, after all. At this week‚Äôs council meeting, though southern Europe was able to draw some concessions, only Hungary actually voted against the plan.

text.text: Those southern Europeans are right to grumble, of course. Germany‚Äôs crisis is not just a product of bad luck. Germany has made a series of strategic mistakes going back decades ‚Äì some of which are unforgivable and utterly inexplicable.

Like many in Europe, Germany misjudged Russia‚Äôs intentions. Indeed, even as President Putin‚Äôs tanks massed on the Ukrainian border, Germany still had every intention of pressing ahead with Nord Stream 2, a planned gas pipeline to Russia, which would have supplied a third of Germany‚Äôs gas needs for the next decade. This reliance on piped gas also means that, unlike other countries, like the Netherlands and France, Germany has no infrastructure for importing liquefied natural gas, which would allow it to buy gas from a broader range of countries.

And like many countries, Germany has attempted a disastrous transition to carbon-free energy. The intermittency problems that are inherent to renewable energy mean there are huge energy gaps to fill when the sun doesn‚Äôt shine or the wind doesn‚Äôt blow. This creates a dependency on gas to fill in the gaps.

Most baffling of all has been Germany‚Äôs abandonment of nuclear power. Nuclear energy produces no carbon emissions, but it is still hated and feared by Germany‚Äôs green-leaning establishment. In fact, green thinking exercises such a tight grip on the German political class that the German government appears determined not to extend the lifespan of its nuclear power plants ‚Äì even amid this once-in-a-century energy crisis, and even as it asks for energy-rationing ‚Äòsolidarity‚Äô from other countries.

The crippling gas cuts to come are not a sign of European strength and solidarity. They are an irrational, dangerous reaction to a crisis decades in the making. And they will leave a lot of ordinary Europeans out in the cold.
Fraser Myers

texts.text: is deputy editor at

text.text: spiked

texts.text: and host of
the

text.text: spiked podcast

texts.text: . Follow him on Twitter:

text.text: @FraserMyers
Picture by: Getty.

#Opinion by Maria Zakharova:

üí¨ It‚Äôs been fun to watch the government crisis in Britain unfold, with two key ministers resigning yesterday and five other high-ranking but less important politicians resigning shortly after.

The scandal revolves around recent drunken misconduct by former Minister of State for Europe and the Americas Conservative Christopher Pincher. Prime Minister Johnson now stands accused of being fully aware of Pincher's checkered past when he appointed him Deputy Chief Whip of the Conservative Party in parliament.

Many in Britain and elsewhere were shocked.

But those in the know saw it coming.

One of our diplomats who worked in Britain attended as an observer the Conservative Party conventions that traditionally brought together top Tories led by the prime minister. Our diplomat‚Äôs eyes were wide with amazement when he returned. The party convention looked more like a drunken frat party. A Russian diplomat is unlikely to be spooked by excessive alcohol consumption, but British party officials didn‚Äôt just lose their spatial orientation ‚Äì it was their human orientation, including sexual, too.

Well-dressed party activists start their mornings with high-end champagne. Then they switch to beer, which they drink in mind-boggling quantities. The parties start later in the afternoon with Tories going around the city emptying the liquor shelves of every bar.

The ruling Conservative Party has created nearly insurmountable economic hardships for ordinary hardworking Britons. 

No matter how often they repeat their ‚ÄúMoscow, Kremlin, Putin‚Äù mantra, they are unable to distract the public. People know who brought the situation in Britain to the brink of collapse and even the risk of disunion. Some ‚Äúparty.‚Äù

Looks like Robbie Williams needs to sit down and write a new hit titled ‚ÄúParty like a Tory.‚Äù

This problem is not ours. It‚Äôs a British problem. But London is trying to resolve its domestic problems by looking abroad and engaging in anti-Russian activities, provocations in Ukraine, global economic destabilisation, and financial piracy.

P.S. While I was writing this post, Children's Minister Will Quince resigned.

DE LA ASAMBLEA FEDERAL DE LA FEDERACI√ìN DE RUSIA
¬†con motivo del D√≠a Internacional del Parlamentarismo
¬†
¬†
El Consejo de la Federaci√≥n de la Asamblea Federal de la Federaci√≥n de Rusia, en v√≠speras del D√≠a Internacional del Parlamentarismo, que se celebra anualmente el 30 de junio de acuerdo con la resoluci√≥n de la Asamblea General de las Naciones Unidas (A/Res/72/278) adoptada el 22 de mayo de 2018, hace un llamamiento a los parlamentos del mundo para que contribuyan a crear una atm√≥sfera de confianza y armon√≠a en los asuntos mundiales.
Los senadores de la Federaci√≥n de Rusia est√°n convencidos de que, en el contexto de la crisis del orden mundial moderno y de la formaci√≥n de un orden mundial multipolar, la cooperaci√≥n interparlamentaria y la diplomacia parlamentaria deben contribuir a establecer un di√°logo entre los Estados. Los organismos interparlamentarios internacionales tienen un papel especial que desempe√±ar en el proceso. 
El Consejo de la Federaci√≥n de la Asamblea Federal de la Federaci√≥n de Rusia aboga por preservar y desarrollar el potencial de la Uni√≥n Interparlamentaria como plataforma para el intercambio equitativo de opiniones entre los parlamentos nacionales y se√±ala la inadmisibilidad de imponer a la Uni√≥n Interparlamentaria enfoques unilaterales por parte del Occidente colectivo para resolver situaciones de crisis emergentes en las relaciones internacionales. 
Los senadores de la Federaci√≥n de Rusia colaboran activamente con sus colegas parlamentarios extranjeros en el marco de estructuras parlamentarias internacionales como la Asamblea Interparlamentaria de los Estados Miembros de la Comunidad de Estados Independientes, la Asamblea Parlamentaria de la Organizaci√≥n del Tratado de Seguridad Colectiva, el Foro Parlamentario Asia-Pac√≠fico, la Asamblea Parlamentaria Asi√°tica, la Asamblea Parlamentaria de la Cooperaci√≥n Econ√≥mica del Mar Negro, la Asamblea Interparlamentaria de la Iglesia Ortodoxa.
El Consejo de la Federaci√≥n de la Asamblea Federal de la Federaci√≥n de Rusia establece y mantiene un di√°logo productivo con el Parlamento Centroamericano (PARLACEN), el Parlamento Latinoamericano (PARLATINO), el Parlamento del Mercado Com√∫n del Sur (PARLASUR) y la Uni√≥n Parlamentaria de los Estados Miembros de la Organizaci√≥n de Cooperaci√≥n Isl√°mica para encontrar soluciones a los problemas globales m√°s urgentes de la comunidad internacional.
El Consejo de la Federaci√≥n de la Asamblea Federal de la Federaci√≥n de Rusia subraya que, en el contexto del emergente orden mundial multipolar, es especialmente importante desarrollar y reforzar los v√≠nculos entre los parlamentos de los Estados que pertenecen a organizaciones y asociaciones internacionales como la Uni√≥n Africana, los BRICS, la Organizaci√≥n de Cooperaci√≥n de Shangh√°i y otras.
El Consejo de la Federaci√≥n de la Asamblea Federal de la Federaci√≥n de Rusia se√±ala que cualquier intento del Occidente colectivo destinado a interrumpir el di√°logo entre los parlamentos nacionales de Estados soberanos y a desorganizar el trabajo de las estructuras parlamentarias internacionales es inaceptable y est√° condenado al fracaso.
El deseo de los Estados Unidos de Am√©rica y sus aliados de imponer a la comunidad mundial una especie de ‚Äúorden basado en reglas‚Äù conduce a la destrucci√≥n de los principios democr√°ticos del orden mundial moderno, al menoscabo de la igualdad soberana de los Estados independientes, al resurgimiento de las peores pr√°cticas de dictado por la fuerza, amenazas y ultim√°tum, propias de la √©poca del neocolonialismo.
El Consejo de la Federaci√≥n de la Asamblea Federal de la Federaci√≥n de Rusia se ve obligado a constatar que las acciones agresivas del Occidente colectivo socavan los principios y normas del derecho internacional universalmente reconocidos, incluidos los consagrados en la Carta de las Naciones Unidas.

webpage.description: Debido a las numerosas y prolongadas extorsiones que Estados Unidos y Occidente han impuesto a la Federaci√≥n Rusa, est√°n surgiendo nuevos centros econ√≥micos alternativos que apuestan por pol√≠ticas
webpage.author: Hedelberto L√≥pez Blanch

text.text: El presidente ruso Vladimir Putin habla en el Foro Econ√≥mico Internacional de San Petersburgo, Rusia, viernes 17 de junio de 2022. Foto: AP.
¬øSurgir√°n un G-8 o un G-10 mundiales?
Hedelberto L√≥pez Blanch

Debido a las numerosas y prolongadas extorsiones que Estados Unidos y Occidente han impuesto a la Federaci√≥n Rusa, est√°n surgiendo nuevos centros econ√≥micos alternativos que apuestan por pol√≠ticas comerciales multipolares.

El presidente de la Duma estatal rusa Vyacheslav Volodin afirm√≥ que Washington con su arbitraria pol√≠tica de sanciones ha creado las condiciones para que pa√≠ses con razones para rechazar esas medidas se est√©n uniendo y podr√≠a surgir, lo que llam√≥, el nuevo G-8 en contraposici√≥n al G-7.

Esas son las naciones que no participan en la llamada guerra de las mal denominadas ‚Äúsanciones‚Äù: China, Rusia, Indonesia, Brasil, M√©xico, Turqu√≠a, India e Ir√°n, cuyo Producto Interno Bruto, en conjunto, suma 60 billones de d√≥lares.
Mientras, el Grupo del G-7: Estados Unidos, Canad√°, Francia, Gran Breta√±a, Italia, Jap√≥n y Alemania, solo llega a 45 billones de d√≥lares, o sea, 25 % menor que el supuesto G-8.
A esos pa√≠ses habr√≠a que agregar otros como Venezuela, Sud√°frica, Nigeria o Argentina, por ejemplo, que tienen grandes potencialidades.

Otras muchas naciones de √Åfrica, Asia y Am√©rica Latina tampoco se han plegado a las agresivas y absurdas medidas de Washington que pretende mantener una hegemon√≠a pol√≠tica y econ√≥mica mundial pese a su constante declive en la arena internacional.

Esa pol√≠tica de extorsiones ha provocado una inflaci√≥n generalizada en los alimentos en el mundo, debido a las restricciones para la adquisici√≥n de petr√≥leo, gas, fertilizantes y otros productos de Rusia.

Por ejemplo, el¬†The New York Times¬†titul√≥: La inflaci√≥n vuelve a acelerarse frustrando las esperanzas de alivio. La agencia Reuters publicaba: La inflaci√≥n en Estados Unidos al rojo vivo aplasta las acciones europeas en medio de los temores de recesi√≥n; y televisora CNBC se√±alaba: La fuerte inflaci√≥n y la ansiedad de los consumidores aumentan la preocupaci√≥n por la recesi√≥n.

Mosc√∫ ha enfatizado que esa situaci√≥n ha sido por los errores de Occidente al imponer ‚Äúsanciones‚Äù ileg√≠timas, lo cual ha incidido en la inflaci√≥n global; la destrucci√≥n de las cadenas log√≠sticas y de producci√≥n; aumento de la pobreza y la escasez de alimentos.

La propaganda de Occidente, con el objetivo de convencer al p√∫blico de que la pol√≠tica de amonestaciones aplicada contra Rusia ha debilitado la econom√≠a de la naci√≥n euroasi√°tica ha quedado completamente descalificada.

En contraposici√≥n a las falsas noticias, el Ministerio de Desarrollo Econ√≥mico ruso enfatiz√≥ que el pa√≠s ha enfrentado esas restricciones, entre otras acciones, con el aumento de las operaciones con los pa√≠ses en v√≠as de desarrollo, principalmente con el Grupo BRICS (Brasil, Rusia, India, China y Sud√°frica) al lograr un crecimiento del 38% en el primer trimestre del 2022.
Asimismo Rusia elev√≥ el intercambio comercial con Am√©rica Latina: 2,3 % en abril y 2,5 % en junio.

El potencial del gigante euroasi√°tico qued√≥ demostrado en el reci√©n finalizado XXV Foro Econ√≥mico Internacional de San Petersburgo, que con la participaci√≥n de 14 000 personas de 130 pa√≠ses se firmaron acuerdos por 5,6 billones de rublos, equivalentes a 98 000 millones de d√≥lares.

El asesor de la presidencia rusa y secretario del Comit√© organizador del evento, Ant√≥n Kobiakov, inform√≥ que se signaron 691 acuerdos por valor de 5,639 billones de rublos, pero solo anunciaron los que no representan un secreto comercial. A buen entendedor, pocas palabras bastan.

Durante un discurso pronunciado en el Foro el presidente Vladimir Putin afirm√≥ que la ‚Äú√©poca del orden mundial unipolar ha finalizado pese a todos los intentos de conservarlo por cualquier medio‚Äù.

El estadista puntualiz√≥ que Washington parece no darse cuenta de que en las √∫ltimas d√©cadas se han ido formando y ganando terreno nuevos centros poderosos con sus propios sistemas pol√≠ticos e instituciones p√∫blicas, as√≠ como modelos de crecimiento econ√≥mico que tienen derecho a su protecci√≥n y a garantizar la soberan√≠a nacional.
Agreg√≥ que el objetivo de las sanciones consist√≠a en aplastar la econom√≠a rusa pero no ha tenido √©xito pues se est√° normalizando la situaci√≥n econ√≥mica paso a paso.

Mientras en Europa, argument√≥, los pron√≥sticos de los expertos indican que sumando solo las p√©rdidas directas de la Uni√≥n Europea como consecuencia de la ‚Äúfiebre de sanciones‚Äù contra Rusia, el costo de las medidas punitivas pueden superar los 400 000 millones de d√≥lares.

Por √∫ltimo se√±al√≥ que ‚Äúla velocidad y la escala de los cambios en la econom√≠a global, las finanzas y las relaciones internacionales est√°n aumentando y cada vez m√°s se hace visible el rechazo a la globalizaci√≥n a favor de un modelo de crecimiento multipolar‚Äù.
Ll√°mese G-8, G-10 o G-50, lo cierto es que un mundo unipolar ya no es posible.

webpage.author: Aanchal Nigam

text.text: Image: AP/Pixabay
Only 11% Of Americans Blame Putin's War In Ukraine For Oil Price Hike In US, Reveals Poll
In a blow for Joe Biden, a poll has revealed that only 11% of US citizens blame Russian President Vladimir Putin‚Äôs war in Ukraine for a spike in oil prices.
Aanchal Nigam

texts.text: In the latest indication of Americans losing trust in US President Joe Biden‚Äôs leadership, a poll has revealed that only 11% of US citizens blame Russian President Vladimir Putin‚Äôs war in Ukraine for a spike in oil prices. According to a Rasmussen poll published on Tuesday, the majority of people did not think that it is the

text.text: Russia-Ukraine war

texts.text: which caused the hike in oil prices instead, blamed Biden‚Äôs poor energy policies as the main reason why gas has become unaffordable in the United States.¬†

text.text: The public opinion was uncovered by the poll weeks after Biden blamed ‚ÄúPutin‚Äôs war in Ukraine‚Äù for the oil price hike. However, the Americans who did not blame the Russian and US presidents placed the responsibility for the crisis on the oil companies. While 52% blamed Biden, at least 29% of the respondents suggested that the industry is leveraging the current geopolitical tensions due to the Russia-Ukraine war to jack up the prices.¬†
Biden says its ‚ÄòPutin‚Äôs price hike‚Äô in US

Putin announced the ‚Äúspecial‚Äù military operation in Ukraine in late February and to express support for Kyiv, the United States banned imports of Russian oil and gas in March. According to Russian state media RT, Moscow used to export only 2% ¬†of its oil to the US and Washington is the net gas exporter. However, earlier this month, Biden had levelled fresh blame on Putin for economic woes as US gas and diesel prices hit records per gallon. US President said it was ‚ÄúPutin‚Äôs price hike‚Äù.

‚ÄúThe two challenges on the minds of most working families are prices at the pump and prices at the grocery store. Both of these challenges have been directly exacerbated by Putin‚Äôs war in Ukraine,‚Äù Biden said in remarks near his vacation home in Rehoboth Beach, Del, ‚ÄúThe price of gas is up $1.40 since the beginning of the year when Putin began amassing troops at the Ukrainian border,‚Äù Biden added.
‚ÄúThis is a Putin price hike. Putin‚Äôs war has raised the price of food because Ukraine and Russia are two of the world‚Äôs major breadbaskets for wheat and corn,‚Äù he insisted.
Image: AP/Pixabay

messages.message:
üö© On June 24, 1945, 77 years ago, the historical parade marking the USSR‚Äôs victory in the GreatPatrioticWar over Nazi Germany was held on Moscow‚Äôs Red Square.

Deputy Supreme Commander-in-Chief Georgy Zhukov, dubbed by the people ‚ÄòVictory Marshal‚Äô, was tasked with inspecting the parade, and Marshal of the Soviet Union Konstantin Rokossovsky commanded the parade.

The parade comprised 10 mixed regiments representing all the fronts that fought in the later stages of the Great Patriotic War. There were, in total, 24 marshals, 249 generals, 2,536 officers, 31,116 sergeants and soldiers, who distinguished themselves in combat and received orders and medals for their service.

The parade culminated when a column of soldiers carrying 200 trophy banners and standards of the defeated German army marched through Red Square and threw them at the foot of the Lenin Mausoleum.

Holding Victory Day Parades has become an annually-repeated tradition since 1995.

On June 16, 1963, Valentina Tereshkova performed her historic mission aboard Vostok-6, became the first woman in space. And to this day she remains the only female to have ever ventured to orbit solo. 

Launched from Baikonur Vostok-6 orbited the Earth 48 times and successfully landed in the Altai Territory. The flight took 2 days, 22 hours and 50 minutes. During the flight, Valentina Tereshkova took a series of pictures of the horizon, which was later used to detect aerosol levels in the atmosphere. 

Tereshkova‚Äôs space flight became a global sensation. Three days after the flight, she was awarded the title of Hero of the Soviet Union. Later on, she received the titles of Hero of Socialist Labour of Czechoslovakia, Bulgaria, Vietnam and Mongolia, and also became honorary citizen of 18 Russian and foreign cities.

Today marks the 239th Anniversary of the foundation of Sevastopol.
 It was on this day in 1783 that Rear Admiral Thomas MacKenzie ordered to lay the foundations of the first four stone structures in Sevastopol: a house for the commander of the Sevastopol naval squadron, a chapel, a smithy in the Admiralty, and a wharf, which was later given the name of Grafskaya.

 An important landmark in the contemporary history of Sevastopol was undoubtedly the March 16, 2014 Crimean referendum on the status of Crimea. As a result of the vote, 95.6% of referendum participants spoke in favour of the city joining the Russian Federation.

Today, the legendary Sevastopol retains its honorary title as the main base of Russia‚Äôs Black Sea Fleet, a city of martial glory and valour of Russian sailors.

Key statements made by Director of the Economic Cooperation Department of the Russian Foreign Ministry Dmitry Bilichevsky during his briefing on global food security 

(June 10, 2022, Geneva)

The unfavourable situation on the global food market began to take shape a while ago, not since the beginning of Russia's special military operation. 

It dates back to February 2020 and is linked to the consequences of the COVID-19 pandemic, when the world economy was "disoriented" and had to be restored.

Three reasons behind the current crisis

1Ô∏è‚É£ US missteps in regulating its economy during the pandemic 

2Ô∏è‚É£ EU overestimation of the alternative energy sources resulting in a dramatic price hike

3Ô∏è‚É£ Irrational one-sided sanctions against Russia - one of the world‚Äôs leading food and energy producers 

üá∫üá¶ The current situation in Ukraine was also discussed. 

üìë READ THE FULL STATEMENT
¬°Hola a todos! ¬°Feliz viernes!

#Opinion by Maria Zakharova:

üí¨ How many times do we have to explain who is responsible for the unfolding tragedy in the vegetable oil and grain markets? Still, the talking (not thinking) heads in Europe go through the same song and dance every day. Josep Borrell on Twitter once again blamed the global food crisis on ‚ÄúRussian missiles.‚Äù Who on earth writes this nonsense for him? 

Once again. In lay terms. The sanctions against the Russian Federation have dealt a serious blow to the global economy, which had only just begun to gradually recover from the crisis caused by the COVID-19 pandemic. The sanctions disrupted existing production, supply and logistics chains, and the payments system for our companies. We have a product ‚Äì grain ‚Äì while buyers have the money and the desire to buy it. But sanctions are preventing this from happening in a very simple way, both physically (transporting grain) and financially (paying for it).

This situation has harmed everyone. Disrupted supplies and payments have led to a global food shortage, contributed to a further increase in prices, and threatened global food security. No transactions mean decreased activity, and that combined with growing demand makes prices go up.

And yet, despite the objective transport and logistics difficulties, we remain global market participants in good standing. We fulfill and will continue to fulfill our obligations under international contracts regarding the export of grain, fertiliser, energy commodities and other critical products.

Unlike Europe, we are concerned about the unfolding food crisis. Western experts ‚Äì and even more so the leaders of developing countries ‚Äì understand the importance of Russian supplies of socially significant goods, including food, for the socioeconomic development of the countries of Asia, Africa, Latin America and the Middle East.

This is a flagrant Western hypocrisy.

Russia ‚Äì out of humanitarian considerations ‚Äì wants to ensure that Ukraine can provide itself with grain, including for planting. And what is the West doing? It is taking Ukrainian grain away by the truckload, leaving the Ukrainian population to struggle with the coming shortage. The West's actions undermine food security not only in Africa, but in Ukraine as well.

It seems that the vaunted expertise and intellectual capacity of our colleagues in Europe and America are now being used in the service of propaganda. Nothing too fancy, but they are expanding colossal energy to indoctrinate their population and convince them that the Russians are to blame. No other issues are discussed anymore, not even the economy or infrastructure. Indeed, why solve problems with food, electricity prices, their own inflation or other issues, including cybersecurity, space exploration safety, etc., when every problem can be blamed on the Russians?

Ministerio de Asuntos Exteriores de Rusia: la guerra econ√≥mica de Washington contra Mosc√∫ rebot√≥ en la propia econom√≠a estadounidense.

texts.text: El director del Departamento de Am√©rica Latina del Ministerio de Exteriores ruso,

text.text: Alexander Shchetinin

texts.text: , coment√≥ en una entrevista especial con la TASS el di√°logo sobre Ucrania, la interacci√≥n en medio de sanciones y la elaboraci√≥n de las posturas comunes con los pa√≠ses de Am√©rica Latina en relaci√≥n con los asuntos internacionales.

text.text: ‚ùì El Embajador de Rusia en Caracas, Sergu√©i Melik-Bagdas√°rov, declar√≥ que el Presidente de Venezuela hab√≠a sido invitado a efectuar una visita oficial a Rusia durante el a√±o en curso. ¬øEst√° prepar√°ndose esta visita?

üí¨ Alexander Shchetinin: Venezuela es nuestro socio estrat√©gico confiable. La agenda de la cooperaci√≥n bilateral incluye una amplia gama de temas relacionados con la interacci√≥n en el √°mbito de pol√≠tica exterior, los v√≠nculos econ√≥micos y comerciales, la comunicaci√≥n cultural y humanitaria, los asuntos de la energ√≠a, agricultura, transporte, extracci√≥n de minerales, salud p√∫blica y biofarmacia. Se abordan constantemente a varios niveles.
En cuanto al Presidente Nicol√°s Maduro, siempre es bienvenido en Mosc√∫.

‚ùì El peri√≥dico The Washington Post inform√≥ anteriormente que EEUU admiti√≥ la posibilidad de levantar las sanciones contra el crudo de Venezuela. Seg√∫n la informaci√≥n del peri√≥dico, Washington intenta meter una cu√±a entre Rusia y Venezuela y resolver el problema con los precios de hidrocarburos. ¬øC√≥mo estima Mosc√∫ un posible acercamiento de Washington y Caracas, puede EEUU ejercer con estas acciones una influencia real en la situaci√≥n en el mercado energ√©tico?

üí¨ Alexander Shchetinin: No solo The Washington Post, sino tambi√©n otros medios de comunicaci√≥n populares comenzaron a publicar en mayo, como si hubieran recibido un encargo, la informaci√≥n sobre los planes de la administraci√≥n de Joe Biden de modificar el r√©gimen de sanciones contra Venezuela. Adem√°s, la decisi√≥n de extender la llamada licencia general de cinco empresas estadounidenses (Chevron, Halliburton, Schlumberger, Baker Hughes –∏ Weatherford International) publicada hace varios d√≠as no prev√© algunas relajaciones.

Nuestra posici√≥n de principios no ha cambiado y la hemos manifestado sistem√°ticamente en reiteradas ocasiones. Estamos a favor de eliminar todas las medidas restrictivas unilaterales impuestas por EEUU contra el Gobierno leg√≠timo de Venezuela liderado por Nicol√°s Maduro y de hecho contra este pa√≠s y su pueblo, por la normalizaci√≥n de las relaciones entre Washington y Caracas sobre la base de la igualdad de derechos.

Fue EEUU el que destruy√≥ la interacci√≥n eficaz con Caracas en el √°mbito de suministros de hidrocarburos. Incrementando tenazmente la presi√≥n de sanciones, impuso un embargo a la exportaci√≥n del petr√≥leo de Venezuela y la importaci√≥n de productos petroleros a este pa√≠s. Se empuj√≥ consecuentemente a los venezolanos de la infraestructura financiera internacional, se les priv√≥ de los activos en el exterior, de las posibilidades de completar las p√©rdidas con pr√©stamos en el mercado externo. Hasta durante la pandemia, el r√©gimen de sanciones impuesto por la Casa Blanca no se relaj√≥.

El hecho de que los estadounidenses hayan entrado en contacto directo con Caracas en las actuales circunstancias muestra claramente el oportunismo de su pol√≠tica exterior. Todo ese principio se desmoron√≥ en cuanto la guerra econ√≥mica de Washington contra Mosc√∫ rebot√≥ en la propia econom√≠a estadounidense. Esto es solo un ejemplo de las acciones de EEUU que llevaron a un desequilibrio en el mercado energ√©tico global. ¬†

Nuestros contactos con los amigos de Caracas confirman que all√≠ entienden muy buen ‚Äúqui√©n es qui√©n‚Äù. Nuestra interacci√≥n contin√∫a y se desarrollar√° independientemente de las sanciones, sean las impuestas contra Venezuela o contra Rusia.

‚ùì Se planea celebrar en Los √Ångeles del 6 al 10 de junio la Cumbre de las Am√©ricas, pero muchos pa√≠ses latinoamericanos no han tomado la decisi√≥n todav√≠a si participar√°n en este evento o han renunciado a participar, varios Estados no han sido invitados por EEUU. Los Gobierno de la regi√≥n resultaron divididos por el tema de Ucrania que EEUU y Canad√° quieren hacer central en la agenda. ¬øC√≥mo es la postura de Mosc√∫ al respecto? ¬øSe puede constatar que esta iniciativa ha fracasado? ¬øEn qu√© medida logra Washington y Ottawa imponer a los pa√≠ses de Am√©rica Latina ‚Äúsu voluntad‚Äù en relaci√≥n con Ucrania?

üí¨ Alexander Shchetinin: Seguimos con atenci√≥n la discusi√≥n entre EEUU, Canad√° y los pa√≠ses de Am√©rica Latina y el Caribe en relaci√≥n con la organizaci√≥n y la agenda de la Cumbre de las Am√©ricas a celebrarse en Los √Ångeles. Vemos que son diversas las opiniones en relaci√≥n con la propia cumbre y su agenda propuesta por los organizadores.

Tenemos que constatar la aspiraci√≥n de Washington a celebrar una discusi√≥n ideologizada de los asuntos importantes para la regi√≥n, hacer que responda a sus intereses en el √°mbito de pol√≠tica exterior e interior. Esto fue reflejado, en particular, en la renuncia de EEUU a invitar a los representantes de tres Estados ‚Äî Venezuela, Cuba y Nicaragua ‚Äî a participar en la cumbre.

Quisi√©ramos desear a los Estados de Am√©rica Latina con los que a nuestro pa√≠s unen hist√≥ricamente los estrechos lazos de amistad y cooperaci√≥n mutuamente beneficiosa que en la pr√≥xima cumbre logren centrar la atenci√≥n de sus participantes en la discusi√≥n de la agenda regional real y la elaboraci√≥n de las decisiones que respondan a los intereses de su desarrollo social y econ√≥mico y el fortalecimiento de la estabilidad pol√≠tica interna.

‚ùì El Ministerio de Asuntos Exteriores de Rusia celebra regularmente reuniones para los Embajadores de los pa√≠ses extranjeros para explicar los objetivos de la operaci√≥n militar especial y la situaci√≥n en Ucrania. Se celebr√≥ tal reuni√≥n con los Embajadores de los pa√≠ses de Am√©rica Latina y el Caribe tambi√©n. ¬øC√≥mo reaccionaron los pa√≠ses de esta regi√≥n a la informaci√≥n entregada por Rusia y c√≥mo es su postura en relaci√≥n con la situaci√≥n actual en Ucrania, en general?

üí¨ Alexander Shchetinin: Estamos¬†en contacto permanente, sincero y de confianza con los jefes de las representaciones diplom√°ticas¬†de los Estados de Am√©rica Latina acreditados en Mosc√∫. Este estilo de comunicaci√≥n refleja el car√°cter constructivo y amistoso de nuestras relaciones que destaca los v√≠nculos ruso-latinoamericanos. Sostenemos un di√°logo pragm√°tico, no imponemos a ninguno de nuestros socios esquemas ideol√≥gicos ni les obligamos a hacer una elecci√≥n pol√≠tica: a qui√©n respaldar. Sabemos escuchar y o√≠r a nuestros socios.
Esto nos permite desarrollar la cooperaci√≥n con vistas al futuro, fortalecer y ampliar el √°rea de intereses mutuos en varios sectores que son muchos y tienen un car√°cter objetivo y no sesgado.

En cuanto a las valoraciones expresadas durante la comunicaci√≥n de los altos cargos del Ministerio de Asuntos Exteriores de Rusia con los Embajadores acreditados en Mosc√∫, qu√© su contenido quede un elemento discreto del di√°logo confidencial. Puedo asegurarles que su contenido fortalece la seguridad y contribuye al acercamiento de nuestros pa√≠ses.
‚ùì ¬øSe sostienen contactos con Am√©rica Latina en relaci√≥n con la seguridad alimentaria? ¬øSe han solicitado la ayuda a Rusia? ¬øSe elaboran algunas iniciativas conjuntas en esta √°rea?

üí¨ Alexander Shchetinin: Tales contactos se sostienen en diversas formas, naturalmente. webpage.description: Representatives of the collective West members are tripping over each other as they scramble to accuse Russia of undermining global food security. text.text: Man-Made Famine 2022

Representatives of the collective West members are tripping over each other as they scramble to accuse Russia of undermining global food security. The G7 has issued a special statement in this regard. To be sure, we responded.
Those most deeply concerned reinforced the choir by their solo performances.

The other day, German Federal Minister of Foreign Affairs Annalena Baerbock said on the sidelines of the G7 foreign ministers‚Äô meeting that the situation in Ukraine may trigger global famine. Before that, Joe Biden spoke in a similar vein, ‚ÄúThe American farmers understand Putin‚Äôs war has cut off critical sources of food. <‚Ä¶> If those tons [of grain] don‚Äôt get to market, an awful lot of people in Africa are going to starve to death because they [Ukraine] are the sole supplier of a number of African countries.‚Äù
That is, Russia is now to blame for famine in Africa. No one ever went hungry there before, as everyone knows.
It is easy to debunk this fake manufactured by Washington and its allies with numbers and facts.
Let‚Äôs look at the situation from the perspective of economic experts.

Even before the special operation in Ukraine, international agricultural production was among the worst affected areas due to global economic instability. The current food market situation has been taking shape over at least the past two years. The commodity exchanges show that wheat prices grew by 25 percent in 2021 alone. By February, they were significantly above average prices in 2017-2021 (up to 62 percent). The price of corn has increased by 162 percent and rapeseed by 175 percent within a span of two years. Moreover, prices have retraced from their peak values. These are standard market price fluctuations, which are not unusual for the global grain markets in recent history.
Why have grain prices been rising over the past two years? There are several reasons behind that.

First, it was the COVID-19 pandemic which disrupted supply chains and increased freight and insurance costs. In 2020-2021, the developed economies sharply increased their financial injections into their respective economies in order to overcome the aftermath of the pandemic. The aggregate value of anti-crisis measures in the United States, the EU and Japan amounted to over $8 trillion, which drove the demand up and whipped up inflation (including food prices). The trend was further exacerbated by open trade wars between the key players and persistent sharp contradictions in the agricultural market regulations, which led to food stocks dropping to their lowest over the past 5 to10 years, sending grain prices higher. Moreover, freight rates have almost doubled.

Second, some Western countries hastened their transition to green energy in hopes of developing alternative energy sources at the expense of traditional fuels, which led to increased energy prices. In particular, oil prices in 2020-2022 grew by over 22 percent in the face of a drop in demand during austere pandemic-related restrictions. Natural gas prices have risen significantly as well. As a result, prices for mineral fertiliser went through the roof in December 2021. Prices for carbamide and saltpetre increased 3.5-4 times, and prices for other types of fertilisers surged 2.5-3 times. What do we need mineral fertiliser for? That‚Äôs right, agriculture. The higher the price of fertilisers, the higher the price of a bushel of grain. As a reminder, all of that happened before February 24.

Third, the short-sighted and selfish policy of the developed Western countries has played its role. During the coronacrisis, the United States and Europe actually redirected commodity flows, including food flows, towards themselves, thus worsening the already difficult situation in developing countries that are dependent on food imports. The United States and Europe were buying increasing amounts of food that they did not really need, leaving nothing for the countries of Africa and Asia. The situation was further exacerbated by low food stocks, adverse weather and inadequate investment in this industry.

Amid rising fuel and fertiliser prices, farmers began to reduce the planted acreage across the board, which made agricultural produce increasingly scarce against the backdrop of ever-growing demand. A drop in supply amid growing demand means higher prices.

Fourth, the sanctions, which are of primary importance. The unilateral economic pressure measures imposed by the collective West on our country in February-March 2022 exacerbated the negative trends on the global food and energy markets and in the manufacturing industry. Payment restrictions and supply chain disruptions affected all economic operators, including agricultural companies, which ran into financial and transport difficulties when servicing food contracts. In the face of uncertainty, agricultural producers started questioning their choices concerning investment in expanding or even maintaining their operations. Some have decided to change how they do business, which further reduced supply on the market.

Unilateral sanctions, including threats of wide-sweeping arrests of dry cargo ships and disconnecting Russian financial institutions from SWIFT, have significantly exacerbated the problem of disrupted supply and financial chains involving Russian economic operators. Given Russia‚Äôs role in agricultural trade, this could not but affect the food supplies to our partners. Despite being fully aware of Russia‚Äôs role on the global agricultural market and of the challenging global food security situation, the West has nonetheless imposed sanctions affecting the agricultural sector and worsened the already distressing situation.
Washington, London and Brussels were not concerned about the fact that this could lead to malnutrition, even starvation, in certain parts of the world.

That said, even despite the difficulties manufactured by the West and in full accordance with the previously reached contractual agreements, the Russian Federation will continue to fulfil in good faith its obligations concerning the export of agricultural produce, fertilisers, energy and other critical products.

For many years now, we have been accused of creating threats to energy security and hearing claims that Russia is weaponising its gas supplies and can cut them off if it deems that something went wrong for it.

The ‚Äúif something‚Äù situation is here, but Russia continues its gas supplies. Those who intimidated the world with tales of the Russian energy switch, namely, Washington, are forcing everyone to say no to Russian gas.
So, who has created the threat to energy security? Ditto for the food.

text.text: El D√≠a de la Gran Victoria: historia, lecciones y actualidad

author.text: Art√≠culo del Embajador ruso en Uruguay Andrey Budaev

texts.text: ‚òùÔ∏è El 9 de mayo se conmemora el

text.text: 77¬∫ Aniversario de la Victoria en la Gran Guerra Patria

texts.text: (Segunda Guerra Mundial) que fue el conflicto b√©lico m√°s sangriento, mortal y desastroso en toda la historia de la humanidad.

text.text: 61 Estados participaron

texts.text: en la conflagraci√≥n, las acciones militares

text.text: cubr√≠an el territorio de 40 pa√≠ses

text.text: 50 millones

texts.text: , de los cuales 26 millones eran los ciudadanos de la Uni√≥n Sovi√©tica. Fue un hecho realmente fuera de la imaginaci√≥n normal. Por primera vez en la historia, la apuesta fue la conservaci√≥n de la vida de pa√≠ses y pueblos enteros. Las c√°maras de gas y los crematorios de Oswicim, Auschwitz y otros campos de la muerte instalados por los nazis demostraron claramente qu√© tra√≠a consigo el fascismo, qu√© futuro preparaba para el mundo su as√≠ llamado

text.text: ¬´nuevo orden mundial¬ª
La Uni√≥n Sovi√©tica junto con otros pa√≠ses de la coalici√≥n anti-hitleriana (Estados Unidos, Gran Breta√±a, Francia, China) lograron vencer la peste negra del fascismo.

texts.text: Pero la verdad hist√≥rica consiste en que el pueblo ruso y otros pueblos de la ex Uni√≥n Sovi√©tica y su Ej√©rcito Rojo desempe√±aron un

text.text: papel decisivo

texts.text: para cerrar a los agresores fascistas el camino hacia su expansi√≥n a otros pa√≠ses, continentes y el dominio mundial. Justamente en el frente germano-sovi√©tico se libraron las principales batallas de la Segunda Guerra Mundial. Entre 1941 y 1945 all√≠ luchaban m√°s del 70% de las tropas de las Fuerzas Armadas de Alemania. Justamente all√≠ se decid√≠a el

text.text: destino de la guerra.¬†

texts.text: El Ej√©rcito Rojo Sovi√©tico derrot√≥ 507 divisiones alemanas fascistas y 100 divisiones de los aliados de Hitler, casi 3,5 veces m√°s que las aniquiladas en otros frentes de la Segunda Guerra Mundial, donde actuaban nuestros aliados. En el frente germano-sovi√©tico las Fuerzas Armadas del Tercer Reich sufrieron sus p√©rdidas principales. Los alemanes perdieron 10 millones de combatientes, entre muertos y prisioneros, es decir, el 73% de todas sus p√©rdidas militares. En este frente fueron derribados 70 mil aviones alemanes, el 75% de la aviaci√≥n hitleriana, y destruidos 50 mil tanques, o sea, el 75% de todo el arsenal b√©lico nazi.

text.text: A veces es muy dif√≠cil imaginar estas cifras, pero es la verdad, es la verdad hist√≥rica.¬†

texts.text: El Sr. Winston Churchill, quien en aquel entonces era el Primer Ministro de Gran Breta√±a, escribi√≥ que

text.text: ¬´fue justamente el Ej√©rcito Rojo de Rusia el que sac√≥ las tripas a la m√°quina de guerra hitleriana¬ª

texts.text: . El Sr. Dwight Eisenhower, Comandante en Jefe de las tropas norteamericanas en Europa y futuro Presidente de los EE.UU., se vio obligado a declarar p√∫blicamente que

text.text: ¬´las magnas haza√±as del Ej√©rcito ruso durante la guerra contra Alemania despertaron la admiraci√≥n de todo el mundo¬ª

texts.text: . √âl tambi√©n destac√≥ la maestr√≠a operativa de los dirigentes pol√≠ticos y militares de Rusia, especialmente del comandante supremo I√≥sif Stalin, los mariscales Gueorgui Zh√∫kov, Konstant√≠n Rokossovski, Semi√≥n Timoshenko y otros, que supieron movilizar todos los recursos humanos y materiales de Rusia para lograr la gran victoria.¬†

Es de conocimiento general que la meta principal de los dirigentes de Alemania fascista era conquistar a la Uni√≥n Sovi√©tica y destruirla como Estado, aniquilar o esclavizar a los pueblos eslavos, exterminar a los jud√≠os. Esto fue genocidio real. El holocausto fue una gran tragedia para todo el mundo: m√°s de 6 millones de jud√≠os fueron exterminados.

text.text: Por primera vez en la historia de la humanidad se trataba dela sobrevivencia de pueblos enteros.¬†

texts.text: En el calendario de efem√©rides de Rusia

text.text: el 9 de mayo ocupa un lugar especial

texts.text: . Es una fiesta muy importante y muy significativa para el pueblo ruso. Hasta el d√≠a de hoy, al transcurrir 77 a√±os, dif√≠cilmente se puede encontrar una familia rusa que no fue afectada por las llamas de aquella guerra.

text.text: Las duras pruebas que afectaron a los pueblos de la Uni√≥n Sovi√©tica mostraron la grandeza del esp√≠ritu humano y generaron numerosos ejemplos de hero√≠smo personal y colectivo y de verdadero patriotismo de nuestra gente.

texts.text: Justamente por esto aquella guerra se llama en nuestro pa√≠s la Gran Guerra Patria. Por la tradici√≥n

text.text: honramos y rendimos homenaje especial a nuestros veteranos de la guerra

texts.text: , los h√©roes-libertadores que lamentablemente se quedan cada d√≠a menos entre nosotros: por heridas, enfermedades y edad avanzada se van para otro mundo.
La victoria en la Segunda Guerra Mundial condujo a la

text.text: liberaci√≥n de los territorios de muchos Estados europeos

texts.text: ocupados por la Alemania Nazi, y tambi√©n influy√≥ de manera importanteal desarrollo de los acontecimientos de postguerra. En particular,

text.text: estimul√≥ la lucha por la liberaci√≥n nacional en los pa√≠ses de Asia y √Åfrica

texts.text: y como resultado cay√≥ el sistema colonial vergonzoso e infame. Otro resultado grande de la Segunda Guerra Mundial fue la

text.text: fundaci√≥n en 1945 de la Organizaci√≥n de las Naciones Unidas

#Opinion by Russian MFA Spokeswoman Maria Zakharova

Nuclear DisInfo (Read in full)

Mechanisms for information attacks with a new thesis that target the public space have been launched in the West at the highest level in a transboundary and trans-format manner. The premise is primitive and completely horrifying: the Russians are threatening a nuclear war, and the Russians are waving the nuclear stick.

‚ÅâÔ∏è Do I even need to say that this thesis is absolutely incorrect and false? Apparently, I do.

They are pushing this exact thesis because it plays on basic human fears, the experience of the older generation, which throughout the second half of the 20th century was bracing for the Third World War against global communism, and Western youth, for which their respective governments have come up with a new mechanism called ‚Äúcancel culture‚Äù (cancelling everything Russian this time). Moreover, the West absolutely does not care what Moscow really says, and the meaning of words is distorted and outwardly perverted.

Let‚Äôs consider the specifics.

Two days ago, in his answer to a question by Dimitri Simes during an interview, Sergey Lavrov said literally the following üëâ full quote

What are the takeaways?

1. It was Russia that, with great difficulty, convinced the United States during lengthy talks to reaffirm the Gorbachev-Reagan formula that a nuclear war cannot be won and must never be fought.

2. It was Russia that persuaded the group of five nuclear nations to adopt a statement with the same content.

3. There are risks; they should not be blown out of proportion or underestimated.

We did everything possible to prevent a nuclear war, to create all the necessary obstacles on the way to slipping into this scenario (fortunately, they justified themselves during the Cold War and are working today), because we understand the real risks and threats posed by irresponsible behaviour in this area. We cannot allow the very thought of a nuclear war.

Now acting in the worst traditions of disinformation, Western officials are feeding the media, in a coordinated effort, fake news about Moscow‚Äôs alleged nuclear threats. The foreign ministries from the NATO countries started convincing the people in their countries that the Russians were ‚Äúrattling their weapons.‚Äù

<...>

Notice how clumsy this was in terms of media work. First, all the put-up quotes against our country were repeated by the journalist, and then they were again mentioned by Ned Price. A presentation designed for a not too sophisticated public. No one even paid attention to what the Foreign Minister said about the risks and Russia‚Äôs attempts to prevent the unthinkable.

It‚Äôs unthinkable to us, but, mindful of Hiroshima and Nagasaki, it is, unfortunately, possible for our colleagues from overseas.

The next day, the media started mass brainwashing. The British tabloids (the Daily Mail and others) and the high-quality analytical US press, French television and German tabloid magazines started talking with one voice that Moscow was threatening with a Third World Nuclear War. And this was already being discussed in Europe; French Foreign Minister Jean-Yves Le Drian said that the Russian Foreign Minister‚Äôs words were the ‚Äúrhetoric of intimidation.‚Äù  

I would like to ask this Frenchman whether he at least saw what Sergey Lavrov said? We have translated the interview.

Our country is against any nuclear war, and this is exactly what the Russian Minister said, and this is what guides our diplomacy in its work.

Could it be that the Western capitals read the interviews as presented by the Western media? This is the only thing that can justify their words. To avoid that, one should simply DON'T turn off alternative sources of information, and listen to what Russia has to say close to the original text, rather than as interpreted by your media under NATO guidelines.

text.text: Nuclear DisInfo

Mechanisms for information attacks with a new thesis that target the public space have been launched in the West at the highest level in a transboundary and trans-format manner. The thesis is primitive and completely horrifying: the Russians are threatening a nuclear war, and the Russians are waving the nuclear stick.
Do I even need to say that this thesis is absolutely incorrect and false? Apparently, I do.

They are pushing this exact thesis because it plays on basic human fears, the experience of the older generation, which throughout the second half of the 20th century was bracing for the Third World War against global communism, and Western youth, for which their respective governments have come up with a new mechanism called ‚Äúcancel culture‚Äù (cancelling everything Russian this time). text.text: said

text.text: ‚ÄúFor many years, as far back as during the Donald Trump presidency, we called for Moscow and Washington to reaffirm at the highest level the 1987 statement by Mikhail Gorbachev and Ronald Reagan, who said that a nuclear war cannot be won and must never be fought. We tried to convince Donald Trump‚Äôs team to reaffirm this statement, considering its importance for our nations and for the entire world. Unfortunately, we failed to persuade our colleagues that this step was needed. However, we reached common ground with the Joe Biden administration quite quickly, and our presidents issued the statement in June 2021 during their Geneva summit. In January 2022, we fulfilled another initiative to this effect. The five permanent members of the UN Security Council adopted a statement along the same lines, which was supposed to coincide with the opening of the Review Conference of the Parties to the Treaty on the Non-Proliferation of Nuclear Weapons. All five leaders put their signatures under the statement that a nuclear war must never happen. This is our position of principle, and we are committed to it. The risks are quite high today. I would not like to see them blown out of proportion, but many would love to do it. This threat is serious and real.‚Äù
What are the takeaways?
1. It was Russia that, with great difficulty, convinced the United States during lengthy talks to reaffirm the Gorbachev-Reagan formula that a nuclear war cannot be won and must never be fought.
2. It was Russia that persuaded the group of five nuclear nations to adopt a statement with the same content.
3. There are risks; they should not be blown out of proportion or underestimated.

We did everything possible to prevent a nuclear war, to create all the necessary obstacles on the way to slipping into this scenario (fortunately, they justified themselves during the Cold War and are working today), because we understand the real risks and threats posed by irresponsible behaviour in this area. We cannot allow the very thought of a nuclear war.

Acting in the worst traditions of disinformation, Western officials are feeding the media, in a coordinated effort, fake news about Moscow‚Äôs alleged nuclear threats. The foreign ministries from the NATO countries started convincing the people in their countries that the Russians were ‚Äúrattling their weapons.‚Äù

First, the media waylaid US Secretary of Defence Lloyd Austin in Germany and later quoted him as saying that ‚Äúthe Russians are threatening us with a bomb.‚Äù Then, CIA Director William Burns spoke to the same topic in Atlanta. At the same time, retirees, including former US Secretary of Energy Ernest Moniz, were pulled out of mothballs to continue to flood the discourse with the ‚ÄúRussian atomic threat.‚Äù

texts.text: All of that was a warm-up to US State Department Spokesperson Ned Price calling the Russian Minister‚Äôs words ‚Äúbluster‚Äù and at the same time, paradoxically, positing a ‚Äúpotential nuclear escalation‚Äù during a

by Maria Zakharova

 Boris Johnson has urged the Russian government to treat the Briton detained in Mariupol while fighting on the side of the Ukrainian government forces ‚Äúhumanely and compassionately.‚Äù

Here is what we have to say in this respect. 

Boris, we know that you personally and your Government have disavowed the British subjects who have fallen victim to British propaganda and went to Ukraine as mercenaries to kill people there. 

Don‚Äôt pretend to be worried. You are utterly unconcerned about the fate of Britons in trouble. They didn‚Äôt drink champagne with you at Downing Street, and so they can wait for your protection till kingdom come. 

I would like to tell the following to those Britons who are concerned about their compatriots: Don‚Äôt worry, Russia is taking care of them. They are given food and drink, as well as any other assistance they may need, just as the other foreigners who have surrendered or have been detained.

Unlike the Ukrainian fighters who brutally kill prisoners and torture civilians, the Russian Armed Forces are committed to humanitarian law. If there were no media censorship in Britain, everyone there would know this.

At the same time, we urge the British authorities to treat the citizens of Ukraine ‚Äúhumanely and compassionately,‚Äù as Boris Johnson said, by stopping the delivery of weapons to Ukraine. The more weapons London is sending to Ukraine, the more citizens of Ukraine die as a result. But the BBC will never tell Britons about that.

messages.message:
By Maria Zakharova:

 We have been saying for the past eight years that the West is training Ukrainian nationalists. The ‚Äúexceptional‚Äù and ‚Äúcivilised‚Äù countries refused to listen, but we continued to make our point with facts in hand. That was easy: you only had to go to Ukraine to see the regular events involving SS Waffen veterans, torchlight marches and the huge portraits of Nazi accomplices on buildings in Ivano-Frankovsk, Lvov and Ternopol.

This week, Canadian correspondent Simon Coutu published the results of a simple investigation on his page at Radio Canada. He studied the pictures posted to social media by the National Guard of Ukraine and compared them to the training programmes conducted for the Ukrainian military by the Canadian Department of National Defence. What did he see?

He writes that many photographs made at the Canada-sponsored training centre in Zolochyov show men in fatigues with the symbols of SS divisions Das Reich and Galizien on their sleeve patches. The experts Coutu contacted have confirmed that these men are neo-Nazis, most probably from the Azov regiment.  Moreover, Coutu writes that the Azov Regiment has been incorporated into the Ukrainian National Guard as ‚Äúa special detachment of Military Unit 3057.‚Äù  He also found out that Canada has spent nearly a $1 billion on training the Ukrainian military since 2014. How much of these funds went to train neo-Nazis? It‚Äôs anybody‚Äôs guess.

‚òùÔ∏è As I have said, the Canadian journalist has simply looked at the pictures and has seen what we have been talking about for years. He just looked at the photographs. We call for this every day.

Do you understand now why Russian film director Elem Klimov named his film about Nazism ‚ÄúCome and See‚Äù? Sometimes that is all that is needed. But it turns out that even this takes a great deal of courage.

Vlad√≠mir Putin destac√≥ que Mosc√∫ no duda que se consigan todos los objetivos de la operaci√≥n militar rusa en Ucrania:

üî∫ "Los objetivos son muy claros y nobles. El objetivo principal es ayudar a la gente en Donbass".

üî∫ "Por desgracia, las autoridades de Kiev, empujadas por Occidente, se negaron a cumplir los Acuerdos de Minsk destinados a resolver los problemas de Donbass por v√≠a pac√≠fica. Era imposible seguir aguantando este genocidio".

üî∫ "[Las fuerzas antirrusas] empezaron a convertir a Ucrania en un trampol√≠n contra Rusia, empezaron a criar las semillas del nacionalismo y el neonazismo que estaban all√≠ desde hace tiempo".

üî∫ "Era imposible evitar una confrontaci√≥n con estas fuerzas, simplemente estaban buscando el momento para su ataque".

@rtadiario

Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov‚Äôs interview with Rossiya television network (April 11, 2022)


üí¨ This is a major shift in the policy of the EU and the entire West under the leadership of the US (there is no doubt about that) that occurred after the start of our special military operation. Their current policy is rooted in bitterness and derangement (excuse the non-diplomatic word choice), though it‚Äôs not all about Ukraine but rather turning that country into a bridgehead from which Russia can finally be subjugated and subordinated to the global system built by the West even though the Cold War ended and the USSR and Warsaw Treaty disappeared. 

The West was moving closer to our borders all the time despite its promises not to expand NATO, statements to the effect that we were no longer adversaries and many other things. Our special military operation is designed to put an end to NATO‚Äôs unlimited expansion and to keep the US and other NATO countries from achieving total world domination.

‚ùóÔ∏èNew false staged provocations to accuse the Russian Armed Forces of allegedly abusing the population of Ukraine are being prepared by the Kiev regime under the guidance of the British intelligence services in Sumy region.

‚ùóÔ∏èRepresentatives of the Ukrainian and Western media have been invited to Seredina Buda town in Sumy Region, which was formerly under the control of Russian troops, to conduct staged video footage. In order to conceal the provocation and prevent it from being exposed by real witnesses, a curfew has been imposed in the city and the local population has been forcibly evicted from the places where the filming took place.

‚ñ´Ô∏èIn Nizhnyaya Syrovatka near Sumy, bodies are being dragged into one of the basements of residential buildings to be presented as allegedly another victim of the Russian Army. As conceived by the "British filmmakers", units of Russian troops allegedly massacred and humiliated civilians as they withdrew. Another fake will be promoted by the Western media in the very near future. Its aim is to further increase Russophobia against the backdrop of Europe's rapidly developing economic crisis.

‚ùóÔ∏èPlease note that Russian troops withdrew from this location three weeks ago - on March 20. Such events, if they really happened, could not have failed to become public in such a long period. Moreover, the Kiev regime is looking for any reasons to accuse Russia of genocide of the Ukrainians. A whole network of foreign information-psychological influences on the population is currently operating in Ukraine, producing "dirty tricks" on a professional basis. We will see the results of their anti-Russian activities more than once.

‚ñ´Ô∏èThe Ukrainian authorities also make extensive use of interested countries and non-profit organisations. 

‚ñ´Ô∏èFor example, the French leadership has sent a group of French servicemen and the Gendarmerie to Ukraine to collect information on alleged crimes committed by Russian servicemen, together with representatives of the "International Commission on Missing Persons" (created at the initiative of the USA). 

‚ñ´Ô∏èOn April 11, French special operations forces personnel, together with technical experts from the French Gendarmerie and the Interior Ministry, arrived in Ukraine via Germany and Poland through the so-called "diplomatic corridor".

Given the partisanship of these "experts", there is no hope of an impartial investigation. Apparently, their main areas of activity will be to cover up numerous war crimes against the population of Ukraine and the Donetsk and Lugansk people's republics committed by the Ukrainian authorities over the last eight years, as well as fabricating accusations against the Russian Armed Forces.

‚ñ™Ô∏è La fecha conmemora la heroica sublevaci√≥n de los recluidos en el campo nazi de Buchenwald, uno de los m√°s grandes en el Tercer Reich.

‚ñ™Ô∏è El 11 de abril de 1945, los presos, al enterarse de que las tropas de los aliados estaban cerca, se levantaron, desarmaron y apresaron a unos 200 guardianes y tomaron en sus manos la direcci√≥n del campo, hasta que en Buchenwald entraron las unidades estadounidenses.

‚ñ™Ô∏è Antes y durante la Segunda Guerra Mundial, los nazis desarrollaron una enorme red de campos de concentraci√≥n. En el territorio de Alemania, sus sat√©lites y los pa√≠ses ocupados funcionaban 14 000 "f√°bricas de la muerte".

‚ñ™Ô∏è Del total de los 18 millones de los prisioneros de los campos de concentraci√≥n nazis, 11 millones perdieron la vida en los puntos de matanza.

 ‚ñ´Ô∏èThe Russian Armed Forces did not have or plan to carry out any firing missions in Kramatorsk city on April 8.

 ‚ñ´Ô∏èWe emphasize in particular that Tochka-U tactical missiles, the wreckage of which was found near the Kramatorsk railway station and published by eyewitnesses, are used by Ukrainian Armed Forces only.

DECLARACI√ìN COMPLETA

üí¨ Canciller Sergu√©i Lavrov: EEUU puso fin a todos los intentos de Europa de aspirar a la independencia con autonom√≠a estrat√©gica. Si a EEUU le parece que en alguna parte del mundo, sea Irak, Libia, Siria, es decir, a miles de kil√≥metros del suelo estadounidense, surgen algunas ‚Äúamenazas‚Äù que luego suelen ser noticias falsas basadas en pruebas falsificadas, EEUU ‚Äútiene derecho‚Äù a hacer lo que quiera: matar a cientos de miles de civiles o arrasar las ciudades.

‚ö°Ô∏è Foreign Ministry statement regarding Twitter‚Äôs act of censorship ‚ö°Ô∏è 

‚ùóÔ∏è On April 5, the US social media company Twitter resorted to a blatant act of censorship by concealing a post on the Russian Foreign Ministry‚Äôs official account in English behind a warning that it violates the platform‚Äôs rules. The post covered the main points of the Russian Defence Ministry‚Äôs statement about the provocation in the Ukrainian town of Bucha and a link to the full text of the statement. The material was marked as "offensive" (supposedly violating "abusive behaviour"... with facts apparently) and the ability of Twitter users to share it has been drastically curtailed. This is the first time such a restriction has been placed on the Foreign Ministry‚Äôs verified account since it was created in 2011.

We regard this step as clear confirmation that Twitter as well as other US tech companies are direct participants in an unprecedented act of information aggression launched by Washington and its satellites, which is designed to shape international public opinion, creating a vastly distorted picture of events in Ukraine. Large-scale measures are being taken to conceal the horrendous crimes committed by the Kiev regime that is steeped in Nazi ideology. The fabrication of pretexts for ramping up political and sanctions pressure on Russia and flooding Ukraine with an endless supply of weapons continues unabated. Before it was censored, the post was seen by over two million users, mainly outside of Russia. Obviously, the widespread interest prompted Twitter executives to resort to these unscrupulous methods.

‚òùÔ∏è We demand that Twitter immediately restore access to this post. There can be no place for bias in the company‚Äôs content moderation in the future. Otherwise, it may acquire a reputation as an accomplice to the Kiev regime‚Äôs atrocities.

üóì El 4 de abril de 1949, 12 estados - EEUU, Canad√°, Gran Breta√±a, Francia, Italia, Portugal, Dinamarca, Noruega, B√©lgica, Holanda, Luxemburgo e Islandia - firmaron el Tratado del Atl√°ntico Norte, que constituy√≥ a la OTAN.

Antes del colapso de la URSS, hubo tres olas de expansi√≥n: 1952 - Grecia y Turqu√≠a, 1955 - Alemania Occidental, desde 1991 - Rep√∫blica Federal de Alemania unificada, en 1982 - Espa√±a.

A principios de los 1990, los "socios" occidentales prometieron que la OTAN no aceptar√≠a nuevos miembros y no mover√≠a su infraestructura militar hacia el este.
